title: Ranji Trophy 2024/25 squads: Full list of teams announced so far
description: Check out the full list of squads for the 2024/25 Ranji Trophy season, India's premier first-class competition that begins on October 11.
author: Atri Sanfui
excerpt: Check out the full list of squads for the 2024/25 Ranji Trophy season, India's premier first-class competition that begins on October 11.
text: Oct 10, 2024 1 minute read News Check out the full list of squads for the 2024/25 Ranji Trophy season, India's premier first-class competition that begins on October 11. Ranji Trophy 2024 to be split into two phases The 2024-25 Ranji trophy will be held in two phases to minimise weather disruptions in Northern India during winter. Last year, the tournament was held between January and March, after the Vijay Hazare Trophy and the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. This season, the competition will begin with teams playing five league matches during a five-week window before the start of the domestic white-ball tournaments. The last two rounds will be held after the Vijay Hazare Trophy on January 18. The knockout stage will begin on February 8, while the final will be played between February 26 and March 2. The tournament will feature several big-name players. Ruturaj Gaikwad and Mayank Agarwal are captains of Maharashtra and Karnataka, respectively. Left-arm spinner R Sai Kishore, who was the leading wicket-taker – 53 scalps at an average of 18.53 – last season, will captain Tamil Nadu. — Wisden (@WisdenCricket) October 1, 2024 Ranji Trophy 2024/25 full list of squads announced so far: 2 days ago Mumbai Ajinkya Rahane (c), Prithvi Shaw, Ayush Mhatre, Angkrish Raghuvanshi, Shreyas Iyer, Siddhessh Lad, Suryansh Shedge, Hardik Tamore (wk), Sidhaant Addhatrao (wk), Shams Mulani, Tanush Kotian, Himanshu Singh, Shardul Thakur, Mohit Avasthi, Mohd. html:
Oct 10, 2024 1 minute read News

Check out the full list of squads for the 2024/25 Ranji Trophy season, India's premier first-class competition that begins on October 11.

Ranji Trophy 2024 to be split into two phases

The 2024-25 Ranji trophy will be held in two phases to minimise weather disruptions in Northern India during winter. Last year, the tournament was held between January and March, after the Vijay Hazare Trophy and the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

This season, the competition will begin with teams playing five league matches during a five-week window before the start of the domestic white-ball tournaments.

The last two rounds will be held after the Vijay Hazare Trophy on January 18. The knockout stage will begin on February 8, while the final will be played between February 26 and March 2.

The tournament will feature several big-name players. Ruturaj Gaikwad and Mayank Agarwal are captains of Maharashtra and Karnataka, respectively. Left-arm spinner R Sai Kishore, who was the leading wicket-taker – 53 scalps at an average of 18.53 – last season, will captain Tamil Nadu.

— Wisden (@WisdenCricket) October 1, 2024

Ranji Trophy 2024/25 full list of squads announced so far:

2 days ago

Mumbai

Ajinkya Rahane (c), Prithvi Shaw, Ayush Mhatre, Angkrish Raghuvanshi, Shreyas Iyer, Siddhessh Lad, Suryansh Shedge, Hardik Tamore (wk), Sidhaant Addhatrao (wk), Shams Mulani, Tanush Kotian, Himanshu Singh, Shardul Thakur, Mohit Avasthi, Mohd. Juned Khan, Royston Dias.

14 hours ago

Goa

Suyash Prabhudesai, Rohan Kadam, Manthan Kutkar, Snehal Kauthankar, KV Siddharth, Kashyap Bakhle, Samar Dubhashi (wk), Darshan Misal (C), Mohit Redkar, Arjun Tendulkar, Heramb Parab, Shubham Tari, Rutvik Naik, Deepak Gaonkar, Rahul Mehta, Keith Pinto

14 hours ago

Uttarakhand
